Reasoning: **Considering gameplay strategy**

I'm thinking about the best strategy here—if we play small, we can shop and maybe pick up a tarot or planet, but we only have $1 now. Playing small could give us $3, which we need. It seems like using Seed Money isn't possible since we have no money. I feel sticking to a small play is the best option. Plus, if we skip small, we miss out on shop rewards. Order matters for scoring and triggers, especially for Card Sharp. I have to keep track of that!
**Analyzing scoring mechanics**

I've got a few components here: Shoot the Moon is held with a multiplier, and then we have Blue Joker and Ice Cream with chips. The Walkie Talkie has a scoring feature that triggers left-to-right, which is key for multiple jokers. Scoring 10s and 4s seems to stack nicely with chips and multipliers. I note that the polychrome edition adds its own multiplier as well, which is independent. I need to ensure we organize the additive bonuses before applying the multiplicative ones effectively!
**Determining optimal scoring order**

I’m thinking about the order of independent jokers and how it affects multipliers. To maximize our scoring, I’d want to apply the additive multipliers before the multiplicative ones. Shoot the Moon is held and doesn't depend on order, but its trigger matters. Blue Joker and Ice Cream provide chips without order issues. I need Card Sharp and the Walkie Talkie at the end. So, my order should likely be: Blue Joker, Ice Cream, Shoot the Moon, Walkie Talkie, and finally Card Sharp!
**Evaluating scoring order and actions**

During the scoring stage, the Walkie Talkie triggers on scored cards, but its order compared to others is clear—I don't have to worry about that. In the independent stage, I see Blue Joker and Ice Cream add chips, followed by the Walkie Talkie and Card Sharp. Rearranging the order doesn’t seem necessary since the multipliers will always total the same.

I need to proceed with the play_round. Selecting a hand will come later since entering the round shows my hand. So, I'll prepare to output the action in JSON format!

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.
